required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Maternal Obesity on Pregnancy Outcomes in El-Minia Locality
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Maternal Obesity on Pregnancy Outcomes in El-Minia Locality a Case Control Survey Study

brief_summary.textblock: A study will carried out over a period of one year , all obese pregnant women as diagnosed with BMI at the time of 1st ANC visit and before labor ,observation of events during both intra-partum &postpartum periods it will be recorded.outcome will compared with normal other pregnant women

detailed_description.textblock: It is known that obesity during pregnancy has drawbacks for both maternal and foetal outcome The aim of this study is to evaluate and measure the proportion of the adverse pregnancy outcomes attributable to maternal obesity and so reaching to recommendations in order to improve the outcomes and wellbeing of these women and their children.patient will be divided into two groups control group with normal BMI and study group and both compared as regard foetal and maternal outcome The assessed fetal variables will be: fetal birthweight & incubators admission. Data will be retrieved from patients before labor and from investigator observation both intrapartum and postpartum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after delivery of the head
primary_outcome.description: arrest of shoulder more than one minute after delivery of the head

primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of labour or elective CS
primary_outcome.description: foetal weight at time of delivery more than 90th percentil

secondary_outcome.time_frame: onset of labor and for 6 weeks after
secondary_outcome.description: primary or secondary blood loss through birth canal more than 500cc

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of labor and for 6weeks after

clinical_study.condition: Obesity During Pregnancy in Clinical Practice

arm_group.description: The group with the BMI more than 24.9 kg per meter square to study the impact of maternal obesity in pregnancy outcome

intervention.intervention_name: The impact of maternal obesity on pregnancy outcomes
intervention.description: observation of maternal obesity effect in foetal and maternal outcome

study_pop.textblock: pregnant women with BMI more than 24 per meter square body surface area

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- obese
- pregnant
- age 18 -40
- single viable cephalic foetus
Exclusion Criteria:
less than 18 years more than 40 years associated medical disorders patient refusal non cephalic presentation

results_reference.citation: Stüber TN, Künzel EC, Zollner U, Rehn M, Wöckel A, Hönig A. Prevalence and Associated Risk Factors for Obesity During Pregnancy Over Time. Geburtshilfe Frauenheilkd. 2015 Sep;75(9):923-928.

clinical_study.keyword: obesity , pregnancy , maternal and fetal outcome
